file_content.text: You are the one who released us, yes? My companions and I are in your debt.
I am Prince Shange. I alone protested my people's allegiance with the traitorous Republic.
And now, it seems, the Republic has shown its true colors. I shudder to think how long I slept.
It's been at least twenty years.
You were gone a long time.
My condolences.
I'll bet you want to get back at the Republic now.
They must pay.
Commander Byten? I have the Cathar here.
I need to contact someone.
Ah, welcome back, Prince Shange. I've arranged for you and your warriors to be escorted offworld--compliments of the Sith Empire.
Rendezvous with my troops and we'll get you to Cathar. Be careful, though; it's a dangerous trek back.
We have faced down Mandalorian battalions with nothing but our claws--the denizens of this place do not frighten us.
I thank you, Commander Byten--and you, my friend. Farewell.
So grateful. So gullible. The Cathar are going to pitch a fit when they find out about Shange's imprisonment.
A warrior like him should be treated with dignity.
He deserves their support.
Quite. I can see why his followers were drawn to him so.
Yes, I've always found it best to accord the lesser species with the respect they feel they deserve.
Don't forget my part.
Don't worry, we're going to milk this little rescue for all it's worth. Every Cathar will sing our praises.
About time people learned the Republic isn't so squeaky-clean.
Now they'll know the truth.
Given how vocal Shange is, I'm sure the entire galaxy is going to hear about the Republic's little misstep.
With luck, word of Shange's abduction will sow dissent among the other alien species. Turn them against them Republic.
Excellent work on this one. Thanks for your help.
